notes: This database uses a 1:125 silver to bronze value ratio, which was the standard ratio in Greece and the Near East in antiquity. However, it has been argued that in Archaic Sicily the value ratio may have been 1:250 silver to bronze. This is reflected in this conversion by a doubling of the value in grams of silver.

notes: This database uses a 1:125 silver to bronze value ratio, which was the standard ratio in Greece and the Near East in antiquity. However, it has been argued that in Archaic Sicily the value ratio may have been 1:250 silver to bronze. This is reflected in this conversion by a doubling of the value in grams of silver.
